channel.title: Air Pollution Transportation
channel.description: Updated Air Pollution Transportation content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: 2016 Federal Register Notices for EPA's Office of Transportation and Air Quality
item.description:
Federal Register Notices for the current year.

You will need Adobe Reader to view some of the files on this page. See EPA’s About PDF page to learn more.

December 2016

  • December 30, 2016: Reconsideration of Finding That Greenhouse Gas Emissions From Aircraft Cause or Contribute to Air Pollution That May Reasonably Be Anticipated To Endanger Public Health and Welfare (PDF) (3 pp, 276.5 K)
  • December 29, 2016: California State Motor Vehicle Pollution Control Standards; Greenhouse Gas Emissions From 2014 and Subsequent Model Year Medium- and Heavy-Duty Engines and Vehicles; Notice of Decision (PDF) (6 pp, 237 K)
  • December 28, 2016: Change the RFS Point of Obligation; Extension of Comment Period (PDF)(1 pp, 170 K)
  • December 27, 2016: Renewables Enhancement and Growth Support Rule; Extension of Comment Period (PDF) (1 pp, 187 K)
  • December 14, 2016: Notice of Data Availability Concerning the Renewables Enhancement and Growth Support Rule (PDF) (2 pp, 210 K)
  • December 12, 2016: Renewable Fuel Standard Program: Standards for 2017 and Biomass-Based Diesel Volume for 2018; Final Rule (PDF)(59 pp, 1.66 MB)
  • December 6, 2016: Proposed Determination on the Appropriateness of the Model Year 2022-2025 Light-Duty Vehicle Greenhouse Gas Emissions Standards Under the Midterm Evaluation (PDF) (2 pp, 196 K)

November 2016

  • November 29, 2016: Information Collection Request Submitted to OMB for Review and Approval; Comment Request; Information Requirements for New Marine Compression Ignition Engines at or Above 30 Liters per Cylinder (Renewal) (PDF) (2 pp, 196 K)
  • November 23, 2016: Proposed Information Collection Request; Comment Request; Reformulated Gasoline Commingling Provisions (Renewal) (PDF)(2 pp, 176 K)
  • November 7, 2016: California State Motor Vehicle Pollution Control Standards; Malfunction and Diagnostic System Requirements for 2010 and Subsequent Model Year Heavy-Duty Engines; Notice of Decision (PDF) (6 pp, 210 K)
  • November 7, 2016: California State Motor Vehicle Pollution Control Standards; Malfunction and Diagnostic System Requirements and Enforcement for 2004 and Subsequent Model Year Passenger Cars, Light Duty Trucks, and Medium Duty Vehicles and Engines; Notice of Decision (PDF)(7 pp, 219 K)

October 2016

  • October 25, 2016: Greenhouse Gas Emissions and Fuel Efficiency Standards for Medium- and Heavy-Duty Engines and Vehicles--Phase 2; Final Rule (PDF) (797 pp, 13.47 MB)
  • October 24, 2016: Information Collection Request Submitted to OMB for Review and Approval; Comment Request; Registration of Fuels and Fuel Additives-- Requirements for Manufacturers (Renewal) (PDF) (2 pp, 193 K)
  • October 21, 2016: Information Collection Request Submitted to OMB for Review and Approval; Comment Request; Motor Vehicle and Engine Compliance Program Fees (Renewal) (PDF)(2 pp, 214 K)

September 2016

  • September 21, 2016: Information Collection Request Submitted to OMB for Review and Approval; Comment Request; Registration of Fuels and Fuel Additives-- Health-Effects Research Requirements for Manufacturers (Renewal) (PDF)(1 pp, 197 K)
  • September 16, 2016: Agency Information Collection Activities; Proposed Collection; Comment Request; Information Collection for Importation of On-Highway Vehicles and Motorcycles and Nonroad Engines, Vehicles, and Equipment; EPA ICR Number 2583.01, OMB Control Number 2060--NEW (PDF)(1 pp, 177 K)
  • September 2, 2016: Alternative Method for Calculating Off-cycle Credits Under the Light-Duty Vehicle Greenhouse Gas Emissions Program: Applications From BMW Group, Ford Motor Company, General Motors Corporation, and Volkswagen Group of America (PDF)(3 pp, 219 K)

August 2016

  • August 9, 2016: California State Motor Vehicle Pollution Control Standards; Greenhouse Gas Emissions From 2014 and Subsequent Model Year Medium- and Heavy-Duty Engines and Vehicles; Request for Waiver of Preemption; Opportunity for Public Hearing and Public Comment (PDF)(3 pp, 199 K)
  • August 9, 2016: California State Nonroad Engine Pollution Control Standards; Evaporative Emission Standards and Test Procedures for Off-Highway Recreational Vehicles (OHRVs); Request for Authorization; Opportunity for Public Hearing and Comment (PDF)(3 pp, 199 K)
  • August 9, 2016: California State Motor Vehicle Pollution Control Standards; Amendments to On-Highway Heavy-Duty Vehicle In-Use Compliance Program, Amendments to 2007 and Subsequent Model Year On-Highway Heavy-Duty Engines and Vehicles, and Amendments to Truck Requirements; Request for Waiver of Preemption; Opportunity for Public Hearing and Public Comment (PDF)(3 pp, 200 K)

July 2016

  • July 29, 2016: Agency Information Collection Activities; Submission to OMB for Review and Approval; Comment Request; On-Highway Motorcycle Certification and Compliance Program (PDF)(2 pp, 198 K)
  • July 27, 2016: Notice of Availability of Midterm Evaluation Draft Technical Assessment Report for Model Year 2022-2025 Light Duty Vehicle GHG Emissions and CAFE Standards (PDF)(4 pp, 229 K)
  • July 22, 2016: Information Collection Request Submitted to OMB for Review and Approval; Comment Request; Cellulosic Production Volume Projections and Efficient Producer Reporting (PDF)(1 pp, 189 K)

May 2016

  • May 31, 2016: Intent To Disclose Confidential Business Information Contained in Vehicle Sales Data for Model Years 2009-2014 to the U.S. Energy Information Administration for Use in Modeling and Projecting Energy 
    Demand in the Light-Duty Vehicle Sector (PDF)    (2 pp, 179 K)
  • May 31, 2016: Renewable Fuel Standard Program: Standards for 2017 and Biomass-Based Diesel Volume for 2018 (PDF)(40 pp, 780 K)
  • May 25, 2016: Public Hearing for Standards for 2017 and Biomass-Based Diesel Volume for 2018 Under the Renewable Fuel Standard Program (PDF) (2 pp, 199 K)
  • May 23, 2016: Proposed Information Collection Request; Comment Request;   Registration of Fuels and Fuel Additives--Requirements for Manufacturers (PDF)(2 pp, 176 K)
  • May 11, 2016: Meeting of the Mobile Sources Technical Review Subcommittee (PDF)(1 pp, 191 K)

April 2016

  • April 22, 2016: Amendments Related to: Tier 3 Motor Vehicle Emission and Fuel Standards (PDF)(5 pp, 246 K)
  • April 20, 2016: Proposed Information Collection Request; Comment Request; Control   of Evaporative Emissions From New and In-Use Portable Gasoline   Containers (Renewal), ICR 2213.05, OMB 2060-0597 (PDF)(2 pp, 175 K)
  • April 14, 2016: Proposed Information Collection Request; Comment Request;   Registration of Fuels and Fuel Additives--Health-Effects Research   Requirements for Manufacturers; EPA ICR No. 1696.09, OMB Control No. 2060-0297 (PDF)(2 pp, 175 K)
  • April 5, 2016: Proposed Information Collection Request; Comment Request; Motor   Vehicle and Engine Compliance Program Fees (Renewal), EPA ICR 2080.06,   OMB Control No. 2060-0545 (PDF)(2 pp, 175 K)

March 2016

  • March 15, 2016: Request for Nominations for the Mobile Sources Technical Review Subcommittee (PDF)(2 pp, 195 K)
  • March 2, 2016: Greenhouse Gas Emissions and Fuel Efficiency Standards for   Medium- and Heavy-Duty Engines and Vehicles--Phase 2 (PDF)(5 pp, 224 K)

February 2016

  • February 16, 2016: Contractor Access to Information Claimed as Confidential Business Information Submitted Under Title II of the Clean Air Act and Related to the Renewable Fuel Standard Program (PDF)(1 pp, 115 K)
  • February 12, 2016: Information Collection Request Submitted to OMB for Review and Approval; Comment Request; Recordkeeping and Reporting Related to RFS2 Voluntary RIN Quality Assurance Program (Renewal) (PDF)(2 pp, 193 K)
  • February 12, 2016: Agency Information Collection Activities: Information Collection Request (ICR) for On-Highway Motorcycle Certification and Compliance Program; EPA ICR Number 2535.01, OMB Control Number-2060-NEW (PDF)(2 pp, 174 K)
  • February 10, 2016: Contractor Access to Information Claimed as Confidential Business   Information Submitted Under Title II of the Clean Air Act and Related   to the Renewable Fuel Standard Program (PDF)(2 pp, 191 K)

item.dc:creator: sliao

item.title: 2016 Press Releases for EPA's Office of Transportation and Air Quality
item.description:
Press Releases for the current year.

December 2016

  • December 20: Volkswagen to Recall 83,000 3.0 Liter Diesel Vehicles and Fund Mitigation Projects to Settle Allegations of Cheating Emissions Tests on Volkswagen, Audi and Porsche Vehicles

November 2016

  • November 30: Robust Technical Analysis Supports Leaving Carbon Pollution Standards for Cars and Light Trucks in Place Through 2025, EPA Administrator Finds
  • November 23: EPA Finalizes Increase in Renewable Fuel Volumes
  • November 2: Automakers Outperform Greenhouse Gas Emissions Standards for 4th Consecutive Year

October 2016

  • October 20: EPA awards clean diesel grant to Port of Baltimore To improve air quality, fuel efficiency
  • October 5: EPA SmartWay Honors CRST Expedited, Inc., of Cedar Rapids, Iowa, for Exceptional Supply Chain Environmental and Energy Efficiency
  • October 5: EPA SmartWay Honors Convoy Systems, LLC, of Kansas City, Kan., for Exceptional Supply Chain Environmental and Energy Efficiency
  • October 3: EPA SmartWay honors Freight Carriers for Exceptional Supply Chain Efficiency

September 2016

  • September 30: EPA Requests Applications to Reduce Diesel Emissions from School Buses
  • September 29: Chemoil to Retire More Than $71 Million in Credits from Renewable Fuels Market under Settlement with U.S.
  • September 29: EPA Requests Applications to Reduce Diesel Emissions from School Buses
  • September 27: Two North Carolina Companies Honored as EPA’s SmartWay Green Leaders in the Freight Industry
  • September 27: EPA’s SmartWay Honors Green Leaders in the Freight Industry

August 2016

  • August 16, 2016: EPA and DOT Finalize Greenhouse Gas and Fuel Efficiency Standards for Heavy-Duty Trucks

July 2016

  • July 25, 2016: EPA Determines that Aircraft Emissions Contribute to Climate Change Endangering Public Health and the Environment
  • July 25, 2016: EPA Determines that Aircraft Emissions Contribute to Climate Change Endangering Public Health and the Environment
  • July 18 2016: US EPA, US DOT, California’s Air Resources Board Issue Draft Technical Assessment Report of Greenhouse Gas Emissions and Fuel Economy Standards for Model Year 2022-2025 Cars and Light Trucks

June 2016

  • June 28, 2016: Volkswagen to Spend Up to $14.7 Billion to Settle Allegations of Cheating Emissions Tests and Deceiving Customers on 2.0 Liter Diesel Vehicles
  • June 28, 2016: TODAY: EPA, DOJ, FTC to Hold Press Conference to Announce Significant Environmental and Consumer Relief in Volkswagen Litigation
  • June 16, 2016: EPA: $1 Million Available for Tribes to Clean Up Diesel Engines
  • June 16, 2016: EPA: $1 Million Available for Tribes to Clean Up Diesel Engines

May 2016

  • May 27, 2016: EPA Plans National Public Hearing for Renewable Fuel Standard Program in Kansas City, Mo., June 9
  • May 18, 2016: EPA Proposes Increase in Renewable Fuel Levels
  • May 18, 2016: EPA Proposes Increase in Renewable Fuel Levels

April 2016

  • April 21, 2016: EPA recognizes SmartWay Affiliate NCTCOG for Fuel Saving Strategies
  • April 21, 2016: EPA recognizes SmartWay Affiliate EDF for Efforts to Reduce Pollution
  • April 21, 2016 : EPA Celebrates SmartWay Affiliates that Support Cleaner Freight
  • April 4, 2016: EPA Report: Diesel Engine Grants Program Nets Major Air, Public Health Benefits

March 2016

  • March 23, 2016: EPA Report: Diesel Engine Clean-up Program Nets Major Air, Public Health Benefits
  • March 23, 2016: EPA Report: Diesel Engine Clean-up Program Nets Major Air, Public Health Benefits
  • March 23, 2016: EPA Report: Diesel Engine Grant Program Nets Major Air, Public Health Benefits
  • March 4, 2016: EPA Rebates Will Help Fairfield and Gray, Maine Purchase Clean Diesel School Buses
  • March 4, 2016: EPA Rebate Will Help Arlington, Vermont Purchase a Clean Diesel School Bus

February 2016

  • February 25, 2016: EPA Announces Availability of $26 Million to Clean Up Diesel Engines Nationwide
  • February 25, 2016: EPA Announces Availability of up to $1.9 Million to Clean Up Diesel Engines in the Southeast Preference given to fleets in areas with poor air quality
  • February 25, 2016: EPA Announces Availability of $26 Million to Clean Up Diesel Engines Nationwide
  • February 18, 2016: EPA awards $389,000 to Gila River Indian Community for cleaner diesel equipment
  • February 18, 2016: EPA Rebates Will Fund Cleaner School Buses in Six Connecticut Communities
  • February 9, 2016: EPA Rebates Will Fund Cleaner School Buses in Three Massachusetts Communities

January 2016

  • January 4, 2016: United States Files Complaint Against Volkswagen, Audi and Porsche for Alleged Clean Air Act Violations
